thread.title: Paul Ryan wins House Freedom Caucus support in speaker bid
thread.title_full: Paul Ryan wins House Freedom Caucus support in speaker bid

author: Anjali Shastry and Thomas Sowell
title: Paul Ryan wins House Freedom Caucus support in speaker bid
text:
Politics Paul Ryan wins House Freedom Caucus support in speaker bid Several members of the House Freedom Caucus had raised concerns about Rep. Paul Ryan. But after meeting behind closed doors Wednesday night the lawmakers emerged to say they would support him in his speaker bid. (Associated Press) more > By THE WASHINGTON TIMES - - Updated: 8:11 p.m. on   
Rep. Paul Ryan secured the support of the House Freedom Caucus, the most conservative of three groups leery of his bid for House speaker, Wednesday night as the young GOP star from Wisconsin rallied to unify Republicans. 
The decision from the group of around three dozen rebellious conservatives gives Mr. Ryan a clear path to the speakership. 
Mr. Ryan, who must win near-universal support if he’s to earn the 218 backers needed to claim the speakership in a vote now scheduled for Oct. 29, met with various factions of the party throughout the day to talk over changes to the way the House operates. 
Support from the Freedom Caucus was not certain since they’ve repeatedly opposed GOP leaders and pushed the current speaker, John Boehner, to announce his resignation. 
Earlier in the day, some members of the group flatly rejected his demand that the House remove its power to oust the speaker midway through a session of Congress, saying that’s a key check on power that was crafted by none other than Thomas Jefferson. 
But after meeting behind closed doors Wednesday night the lawmakers emerged to say they would support him. 
Mr. Ryan, the GOP’s former vice presidential nominee, did not want to run for speaker but yielded to entreaties from party leaders and said he would — if he could gather consensus support.
